<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// registered. This is because the Unix \\ref RegisterHandlers function does</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Initialize the stack printer after installing the one-shot pipe signal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// handler, so we can perform a sigaction() for SIGPIPE on Unix if requested.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We use UTF-8 as the internal character encoding. On z/OS, all external</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// output is encoded in EBCDIC. In order to be able to read all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// error messages, we turn conversion to EBCDIC on for stderr fd.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::string Banner = std::string(Argv&#91;0&#93;) + </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;: &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/exitonerror">ExitOnError</a> ExitOnErr(Banner);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If turning on conversion for stderr fails then the error message</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// may be garbled. There is no solution to this problem.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlight">  ExitOnErr(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad10875fd499e8e285aaeef615e9b11aa">errorCodeToError</a>(llvm::enablezOSAutoConversion(STDERR&#95;FILENO)));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlight">  ExitOnErr(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad10875fd499e8e285aaeef615e9b11aa">errorCodeToError</a>(llvm::enablezOSAutoConversion(STDOUT&#95;FILENO)));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifdef &#95;WIN32</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We use UTF-8 as the internal character encoding. On Windows,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// arguments passed to main() may not be encoded in UTF-8. In order</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to reliably detect encoding of command line arguments, we use an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Windows API to obtain arguments, convert them to UTF-8, and then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// write them back to the Argv vector.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// There&#39;s probably other way to do the same thing (e.g. using</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// wmain() instead of main()), but this way seems less intrusive</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// than that.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::string Banner = std::string(Argv&#91;0&#93;) + </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;: &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// GetCommandLineArguments doesn&#39;t terminate the vector with a</span></CodeLine>
